title: Podere Sapaio 2015 Volpolo  (Bolgheri)
description: Made with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Merlot and 15% Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit, tobacco and a whiff of green peppercorn. It's concentrated, offering black-currant jam, mocha and vanilla flavors alongside assertive tannins.

title: Porterhouse Winery 2014 Williams' Reserve Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: As ode to his family's butchering past, this red blend would go very well with one of the fatty steaks that winemaker Adam Comartin's relatives once cut. Aromas of licorice, sandalwood, lilac and jammy fruits lead into a palate loaded with clove, nutmeg, thyme and pepper spice, all set against a backdrop of boysenberry fruit.

title: Rocca di Montemassi 2015 Sassabruna  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made with 80% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 10% Syrah, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and tobacco. The smooth, savory palate offers Morello cherry, star anise and licorice alongside polished tannins.

title: Valdelana 2014 Agnus Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spicy, briary berry aromas are subtle and reserved, but sound. This wine is firm and a bit drawing on the palate, with flavors of plum, berry fruits and cocoa. Mild berry flavors on the finish are tasty and not pushy or overdone.

title: Winter's Hill 2016 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery makes a trio of Pinot Gris, this one fermented entirely in stainless steel. It's clean and fresh, mountain spring over rock, with green apple and jicama fruit. There's a tension to it, and it's well-defined and taut through the finish.

title: Boeckel 2016 Midelberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose offers a sense of freshness and the palate follows suit, with clean outlines of Conference pear and lemon. There is moderate concentration and a juicy, refreshing finish that is dry and lasting.

title: Boekenhoutskloof 2014 Semillon (Franschhoek)
description: This is currently closed and shy, offering subtle scents of yellow apple, musk melon, white peach and toasted spice. The round, mouthfilling palate boasts more concentration and decadence, with rich flavors of melon, clove-spiked orange and crusty brioche. Try 2019–2023.

title: Botromagno 2015 Poggio al Bosco White (Gravina)
description: This single-vineyard blend of 60% Greco and 40% Malvasia shows spiced aromas of orchard fruit on the nose. Edgy flavors of apple and pear rinds meet almond skin on the medium-bodied palate, balanced by a persistent vein of acidity and a dusting of earthy stone.

title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Les Jardins Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Fleshy red and black cherry aromas set the tone on the nose. The palate adds lots of freshness that is toned down by strucutre. Fine tannins add grip but this is all about hedonistic fruit with a clean, grippy finish. Drink soon.

title: Domaine Pfister 2016 Cuvée 8 White (Alsace)
description: A touch of honey joins the fresh lemon notes on the nose. The fruity, easy and light palate also has that honey-lemon combo. The finish is lip-smacking, easy and fresh.

title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2016 Rosé (Alsace)
description: A very shy, muted nose leads onto a very fresh, easy palate that offers a gentle hint of red apple. The body is light and refreshing.

title: Dopff & Irion 2016 Crustacés White (Alsace)
description: Fresh, vivid notes of juicy, ripe pear make for an inviting nose. The palate has the same easy, fruit-driven freshness: plenty of pear edged by lemon freshness. This is light, dry, easy and moreish. Drink soon.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Dundee Hills Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Pretty fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry come together, balanced against juicy acids. It was 30% whole cluster fermented and aged in 15% new oak, which remains well in the background. Another year or two of bottle age might well improve this wine a point or two.

title: Fattoria di Magliano 2014 Sinarra  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This 100% Sangiovese has aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and white pepper. It's bright and fresh, with crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry and clove. Polished tannins provide lithe support.

title: Helioterra 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This light and elegant wine displays inviting scents of bread, strawberry, raspberry and wet stone, with flavors to match. It's immaculately clean, well-defined and persistent. Drink over the next five years.

title: Johan 2014 Visdom Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: After barrel fermentation (40% new) and extended barrique aging, this wine is bottled with some of the lees left, extending autolysis and intentionally diminishing fruit. It's oaky and textural, with a creamy, yeasty flavor more than any particular fruit. It's unusual and compelling, though not made in any conventional style.

title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A hint of bruised apple plays on the nose but the palate shows ample freshness in flavors of ripe pear and apple, with a tart lemon balance. This is fruity and easy but also rather refreshing. Drink soon.
winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Lieu-Dit Coudrat  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A lieu-dit in French is a place historically recognized for what was there, a hazelnut (coudrat) tree. This wine comes from a single vineyard named after the trees grew there. It is a rich wine, packed with the bright fruit of the vintage as well as some firm tannins. Aged in wood, it has spice and toast as well as the black-currant fruits. Drink this wine from 2021.

title: Luna 2015 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 100% of the variety, this is expectedly dark in color and big and weighty in tannin and oak. Inviting aromas of cinnamon, mushroom, graphite and cedar give it more of a savory profile, searching for fruit, which appears in the form of black currant. The finish is bitter in leather and black pepper.

title: Mamete Prevostini 2015 Grumello Garof  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This opens with aromas evoking red-skinned berry, alpine herb and vanilla. The linear palate offers Marasca cherry, tobacco and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Mamete Prevostini 2016 Botonero Nebbiolo (Terrazze Retiche di Sondrio)
description: Aromas suggesting wild strawberry, rose petal and a whiff of mint take shape in the glass. The lively palate delivers crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry and a hint of cinnamon alongside lithe tannins.

title: Occasio 2014 Telos Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Spicy oak combines with ripe black grape and black-cherry flavors in this bold and nicely tannic wine. Paired with a beefy dish it will be just right. Best after 2020.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2016 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)
description: Pristine lemon and yellow apple notes are marked by saline minerality and whiffs of smoke and nuts in this briskly composed Pinot Blanc. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a revitalizing, cutting sip, with a moderately long lime-zest finish. Drink now through 2021.

title: Taylor Fladgate 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: The style of this LBV changes little. It is always a fruity, ready-to-drink Port, rich in black fruits and juicy acidity. It is perfumed, ripe, warming and lightly structured. It is ready to drink.

title: Tenute Chiaromonte 2014 Muro Sant'Angelo Contrada Barbatto Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)
description: This wine is brooding in dense cherry and red plum aromas, peppered with notes of herbs and violets. The palate is broad, bright, juicy red and black fruit flavors and lively acidity are balanced by the bolstering tannins.

title: Tormaresca 2013 Bocca Di Lupo Aglianico (Castel del Monte)
description: Tight at first, this wine opens to aromas of ripe red berries, tar and coconut shavings. The palate is rich in feel with dark cocoa bitterness, yet juicy acidity builds on the midpalate to reveal fresh berry tones. This needs time in the cellar to fully integrate. Drink from 2022.

title: Trenza 2013 Obispan Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Roasted blackberry and caramelized fennel bulb show on the nose of this blend of 53% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Syrah and 5% Petite Sirah. Prominent licorice spice shows on the blueberry-laced palate, where tannins stick to your teeth and the acidity holds everything up.

title: Triacca 2012 Sassella Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Blue flower, baked plum, vanilla and oak aromas segue over to the bright palate along with black cherry and star anise. Fresh acidity and polished tannins are there to provide support.

title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2016 Gloria Reserva Red (Douro)
description: The spice from aging in American oak barrels is evident in this perfumed wine. It also has ripe berry fruits and acidity as a promise for the future. The wine could do with some aging, so wait to drink until 2019.

title: Cambiata 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rounded red-cherry fruit meets with aromas of potpourri and caramelized oak on the nose of this fairly priced bottling. The oak is very prominent on the palate, lending vanilla and hickory flavors to the red currant and clove base. Acidity washes into the finish.
